author: tmiychao
content: <@&857649635274915900> The next Office hours call is out! And it will be a special one. We are having two guests this time - <@892053833121923094>  and <@199253896399421440> from EF Testing and Security team. You can learn about all the various kind of testing of Ethereum clients, fuzzing, hacking and vulnerabilities in the protocol. Details here: https://github.com/eth-protocol-fellows/cohort-three/issues/293

author: echo_alice
content:
<@178652431868100609> and anyone else working on/interested in light clients, James Prestwich (founder/CTO of Nomad bridge) just released a blog post related to concerns with building bridges via the Altair Sync Protocol:  https://prestwich.substack.com/p/altair.  

It's gotten a lot of attention from core devs + cross chain bridge architects working on/building with Altair and is stirring up conversation about future improvements.  I haven't been following this closely, but figured some of ya might be interested

author: mynervini
content: Thanks, it's a good read for sure, and good discussion in <#595701319793377299>
